document_data.name: Illusk

Notable locations.Darkwalk: A street bisecting the ruins of Illusk and lead to the Dark Arch. It was named for the haunted reputation of the ruins of Illusk.

History.{{Yearlink|-3000}}: The city was founded around this date by [[Ruathym|Ruathen]] seafarers at the mouth of the [[River Mirar]], displacing the local population of ice hunters.
History.{{Yearlink|-2103}}: Illusk and its people were crushed under a [[giant]]-led [[orc]] horde. Even help from [[Jeriah Chronos]] and his [[Netherese arcanist]]s couldn't save the city.
History.{{Yearlink|-425}}: The [[Netherese]] returned to refound the city as a [[magocracy]] ruled by a Grand Cabal of mages led by [[Fynran|Fynran the Flamelord]].
History.{{Yearlink|-354}}: Another Netherese arcanist named [[Melathlar]] arrived in Illusk, fleeing the [[phaerimm]]s. Fearing that he would be followed, Melathlar sarificed himself to magically erect the [[Host Tower of the Arcane]] as well as huge stone walls and spellwards. Over the next several years more and more Netherese refugees migrated to Illusk as their homes in Low Netheril were wasted by the phaerimm ''lifedrain'' magic.
History.{{Yearlink|-111}}: [[The Orc Marches|Several orc hordes]] swept down from the [[Spine of the world]] at once and wiped out both Illusk and [[Gauntlgrym]] as well as most of [[Delzoun]]. Most of the citizens of Illusk managed to flee and the local [[elf]] population united to defeat the orcs. The resiliant netherese descendants then begin rebuilding their homes three years later, restoring Illusk to it's former state.
History.{{Yearlink|-15}}: The Grand Cabal became imperialistic and expand their borders south and east; as a result, they quickly met with elven resistance which then became organized.
History.{{Yearlink|-10}}: In the Year of Burning Glades an elven army led by [[Halueth Never|Lord Halueth Never]] attacked and defeated Illusk<ref name=tGHotR-p59>, though they failed to extinguish all Illuskan resistance. After long peace talks, the Illuskans and the elves agree on making the River Mirar the border between their realms in the [[-4 DR|Year of Pacts]]<ref name=tGHotR-p59 />.
History.{{Yearlink|95}}: Led by [[Uthgar Gardolfsson]], Ruathens returned to Illusk, this time as invaders. They slew the Grand Cabal but the rest of the wizards retreated into the Host Tower. Expecting to be hailed as heroes, the Ruathens were surprised when the Illuskan people burned their ships and drove them out of the city.<ref name=tGHotR-p61> Over the next year, Stefan Blackspear drove most of the remaining wizards out of the city and established himself as Highlord of the city.<ref>
History.[[151 DR]]: Illusk, possibly weakened by its efforts to help rebuild Gauntlgrym, is captured by yet another orc horde and renamed '''Argrock'''. This change doesn't last and after the orcs were driven out the city was recolonized by settlers from [[Yarlith]], [[Uthtower]] and the [[Mlembryn lands]]. [[Taman Steeldrake]] rose to lead these colonists as the first Grand Prince of Illusk.
History.[[306 DR]]: Illusk was attacked again by an orc horde, though this time it was defeated by an army of mercenaries.
History.[[611 DR]]: The [[Everhorde]] leaves the city in ruins with only the Host Tower surviving the assault.
History.[[806 DR]]: [[Laeral Silverhand]], the witch-queen of [[Stornanter]], sealed the [[lich]]es of the Grand Cabal inside the Host Tower and began efforts to rebuild and resettle the ruins. By the time the construction was finished, the city was already prospering thanks to flourishing trade with [[Mirabar]]. This profit was used to obtain resources in order to build strong defensive walls. The city gained strong ties with [[Stornanter]] thanks to their mutual trading ties to Mirabar and then even more so when a Duke of Stornanter became the ruler of Illusk.
History.[[1023 DR]]: After centuries of trade and successfully repelling attacks from [[Uthgardt]], a Grand Prince named [[Galnorn]] tried and failed to conquer Mirabar.
History.[[1044 DR]]: A [[Neverwinter|Neverwintan]] wizard revealed Galnorn to be a [[doppelganger]] and slew it.
History.[[1235 DR]]: Another band of orcs, calling themselves the [[Bloody Tusk]] tribe attacked and besieged Illusk. They continued the siege for 9 long years, ruining the city, until the last human resistance was defeated. The orcs used the ruins as a fortified bandit camp for 57 years until a [[Waterdeep|Waterdhavian]] mercenary army cleared the ruins. With help from Neverwinter, the city was rebuilt and renamed Luskan by the next year.

document_data.After the Spellplague: [[Luskan]] later resided on the ruins of Illusk.{{Fact}}
